detaileddescription.para: All parent headers found, difficulty matches, timestamp >= median previous. Implies all parents are also at least TREE.

Only first tx is coinbase, 2 <= coinbase input script length <= 100, transactions valid, no duplicate txids, sigops, size, merkle root. Implies all parents are at least TREE but not necessarily TRANSACTIONS.

If a block's validity is at least VALID_TRANSACTIONS, CBlockIndex::nTx will be set. If a block and all previous blocks back to the genesis block or an assumeutxo snapshot block are at least VALID_TRANSACTIONS, CBlockIndex::m_chain_tx_count will be set.

Outputs do not overspend inputs, no double spends, coinbase output ok, no immature coinbase spends, BIP30. Implies all previous blocks back to the genesis block or an assumeutxo snapshot block are at least VALID_CHAIN.
Scripts & signatures ok. Implies all previous blocks back to the genesis block or an assumeutxo snapshot block are at least VALID_SCRIPTS.

briefdescription.para: stage after last reached validness failed
block data in blk*.dat was received with a witness-enforcing client

detaileddescription.para: Unused flag that was previously set on assumeutxo snapshot blocks and their ancestors before they were validated, and unset when they were validated.
Maximum amount of time that a block timestamp is allowed to exceed the current time before the block will be accepted.

Timestamp window used as a grace period by code that compares external timestamps (such as timestamps passed to RPCs, or wallet key creation times) to block timestamps. This should be set at least as high as MAX_FUTURE_BLOCK_TIME.

briefdescription.para: Init values for CBlockIndex nSequenceId when loaded from disk.

memberdef.argsstring: (const CBlockIndex &to, const CBlockIndex &from, const CBlockIndex &tip, const Consensus::Params &)
memberdef.name: GetBlockProofEquivalentTime

detaileddescription.para: Return the time it would take to redo the work difference between from and to, assuming the current hashrate corresponds to the difficulty at tip, in seconds.
Find the forking point between two chain tips.
Find the last common ancestor two blocks have. Both pa and pb must be non-nullptr.
Get a locator for a block index entry.
Construct a list of hash entries to put in a locator.
